captions.text: Takes guts you gotta dig down deep then get it out
keep on going again and again and again
until you make it happen because you know...
... that is possible!
The separation of talent and skill is one
of the greatest misunderstood concepts
for people who are trying to excel, who have dreams
who want to do things
Talent you have naturally
Skill is only developed by hours and hours and hours
of beating on your craft
Understand, you are one of a kind
Your character traits
are a kind of chemical mix
that will never be repeated in history
There are ideas unique to you
a specific rhythm and perspective
that are your strengths, not your weaknesses
You must not be afraid of your uniqueness
and you must care less and less what people think of you.
You must have PACIENCE
and engage in CONSISTENT ACTION
patience and engage in consistent action!
But first you have to get mad
You gotta say I'm a human being
GOT DAMN IT! MY LIFE HAS VALUE!
Reality can be rather harsh
Your days are numbered
It takes constant effort to carve a place for yourself in this ruthlessly competitive world
and hold on to it
People can be treacherous
They bring endless battles into your life
Your task is to resist the temptation to wish it were all different
When things get tough...
and you grow tired of the grind
your mind tends to drift into fantasies
you wish things were a certain way
and slowly, subtly
you turn inward to your thoughts and desires.
If things are going well
you become complacent
imagining that what you have now
will continue forever
you stop paying attention.
We live in a world, ladies and gentlemen
where people want instant gratification
they want it right now
Nobody cares what you did or didn’t accomplish ago
they only care about results
that’s how life works on planet earth
RESULTS ARE THE ONLY THING THAT MATTERS
Subtitles by the Amara.org community

comments.text:
I used some extreme adrenaline junkie sports to illustrate the power of 
overcoming your fears and how euphoric it can be to do so. 

One of the integral points I tried to highlight and emphasis as best I 
could was the idea of 'time' and how limited it is. People plan their lives 
as if they are sure of destiny and know they get the full 80 years. But 
life is unexpected, random and you can never know when your time is up. 
That's why its important to chase your goals as best as you can. Hope you 
enjoy the this video. Next week will be fitness motivation. ﻿
comments.author: Absolute Motivation

comments.text:
+ihajeeorbis It really is. Thats why I'm constantly reminding myself of 
this, I keep trying to convince myself that I have social anxiety, and that 
it can stop me. I don't want to tell myself this worn out story that holds 
me back anymore. I want to grow. I want to reach my full potential. 


People that come to these sorts of videos can really see inside themselves, 
and know that they aren't the centre of the universe. It rubs off on to 
people like me who don't usually come to videos like this. Keep your 
positive mindset on everyone, because we all know the biggest battles are 
fought within your mind.
comments.author: Taylor Kern

comments.text:
Absolutely. Well written comment. Time is the only scarce commodity that 
matters in the end. We go through life and never tap into our "intrinsic 
value". Or, our real worth. We scratch only the surface and are content. 

Life is a race against time as it races around the track night to day day 
to night. However do enjoy life as well, simple things like balancing 
family friends love entertainment food laughter sadness and all the 
wonderful things. If you get stressed and bogged down by racing all the 
time it can hurt you by you missing out in certain things. 

Time management is a huge skill to have and I too am just a rookie and 
trying to swim through the ocean.
comments.author: ihajeeorbis

comments.text: This is like one of my favs man.
comments.author: Chris Ross
